# 1. Analyze various coding annotations

<br>

> Annotations include 

+ Ribosnitch (allele-specific)
+ RBP binding sites
+ conservation (GERP)
+ Polyphen-damaging (Mis3)
+ Loss-of-function and Gain-of-function
+ CADD 

## 1.1 For WGS data

Use manuscript data/MSSNG/Simons_519, scaling factors are computed using WGS data, based on coding regions and regions 10kb within TSSs.


### 1.1.1 manuscript meta-analysis data
+ coding RR estimation.[link](analysis/180214_results_summary_manuscript_data_RR_estimation_with_mutrate_adjusted_for_div_coding_features.html)


### 1.1.2 MSSNG data
+ coding RR estimation (scaling file doesn't account for div score).[link](analysis/180216_RR_estimate_DATA_Yuen_2017_ANNO_RR_estimate.html)

+ coding RR estimation (scaling file accounting for div score).[link](analysis/180216_with_div_adjusted_RR_estimate_DATA_Yuen_2017_ANNO_RR_estimate.html)
* [Adjusting mutation rate accounting for div score](analysis/180215_recalibrate_mutation_rate_with_div_score_for_MSSNG_and_Simons_519.html)

Execution code to do data partition and reading-in is `code/pipeline00_generate_R_code_for_estimating_RR_using_partitioned_data`

### 1.1.3 Simons data

+ coding RR estimation (scaling file accounting for div score).[link](analysis/180216_with_div_adjusted_RR_estimate_Simons_519_new_version_ANNO_RR_estimate.html)
* [Adjusting mutation rate accounting for div score](analysis/180215_recalibrate_mutation_rate_with_div_score_for_MSSNG_and_Simons_519.html)

## 1.2 For WES data
From denovo-db

| Name | PMID | Probands | Controls | Type |
|----|----|----|----|----|
|Iossifov | 25363768 | 2508 | 1911 | exome |
|Krumm | 25961944 | 2377 | 1786 | exome |
|DeRubeis2014 | 25363760 | 2270 | 0 | exome |

Need to use the nonfunctional syn mutations to adjust mutation rates.

When adjusting mutation rates, need to generate synonymous mutation rates for each 50 bp window, the file is here `../data/Example_windows_coding_with_nonfunctional_syn_mutrate.bed`

* [clean dataset](analysis/180215_invesigate_ASD_DNM_in_denovo_db_for_WES_studies.html)

### 1.2.1 Iossifov data
+ 2767 coding mutations after filtering, 490 nonfunctional syn mutations.

### 1.2.2 Krumm data
+ 915 coding mutations after filtering, 119 nonfunctional syn mutations.

### 1.2.3 DeRubeis2014 data
+ 1590 coding mutations after filtering, 315 nonfunctional syn mutations.
